alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 1:40PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Santa Rosa, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, La Paloma, Rangerville, Olmito, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Brownsville, Primera, Combes, Lincoln Park, San Benito Fire Department Station One, Landrum Park, Miller Jordan Middle School and San Benito City Hall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
